Method Detail

ensureTexture

public Object ensureTexture(GLContext ctx,
                            boolean repeatX,
                            boolean repeatY)
Creates a texture for this image (if one does not already exist) and returns it. May return null if the underlying image data is not yet ready.

clearTexture

public void clearTexture(GLContext ctx)
Releases this image's texture memory.

reference

public void reference(GLContext ctx)
Increments this image's reference count. Called by ImageLayerGL to let the image know that it's part of the scene graph. Note that this reference counting mechanism only exists to make more efficient use of texture memory. Images are also used by things like Pattern which does not support reference counting, thus images must also provide some fallback mechanism for releasing their texture when no longer needed (like in their finalizer).

release

public void release(GLContext ctx)
Decrements this image's reference count. Called by ImageLayerGL to let the image know that may no longer be part of the scene graph.

x

protected float x()
The x offset into our source image at which this image's region starts.

y

protected float y()
The y offset into our source image at which this image's region starts.

texWidth

protected float texWidth(boolean repeatX)
Returns the width of our underlying texture image.

texHeight

protected float texHeight(boolean repeatY)
Returns the height of our underlying texture image.

updateTexture

protected abstract void updateTexture(GLContext ctx,
                                      Object tex)
Copies our current image data into the supplied texture.
